newsitem.title: USA: Assets of U.S. money market funds rose in week.
newsitem.headline: Assets of U.S. money market funds rose in week.

text.p: Total money market mutual fund assets in the week ended May 7 rose to $952.54 billion from a revised $943.11 billion the prior week, an industry trade group said Thursday.
The Investment Company Institute said assets of the nation's 662 retail money market mutual funds rose $2.43 billion to $636.68 billion in the week.

Of the retail funds, assets of the 402 taxable money market funds rose $1.25 billion to $524.28 billion, while assets of the 260 tax-exempt funds rose $1.18 billion to $112.41 billion, the group said.

ICI said assets of the 324 institutional money market funds rose $7 billion to $315.85 billion. Of these, assets of the 261 taxable money market funds increased $4.80 billion to $282.95 billion, while assets of the 63 tax-exempt funds rose $2.19 billion to $32.90 billion, it said.
ICI revised last week's money market mutual fund assets to $943.11 billion from $943.30 billion.
